Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Sh-lantibiotic-beta (natural AMPs; lantibiotic;  bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, commensal bacteria, prokaryotes; XXW5; UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Staphylococcus hominisA9, Human Microbiota:skin, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 38% similarity toSibaDef.Activity: Active against S. aureus, but not commensal bacteria.Chemical modification:   Four thioether bonds are proposed: S9-C12, S20-C24, T26-C29 and S30-C33. In addition, there are five dehydrated S/T at the N-terminus of the peptide.Updated 4/2024
Literature Information.Author: Nakatsuji T, Chen TH, Narala S, Chun KA, Two AM, Yun T, Shafiq F, Kotol PF, Bouslimani A, Melnik AV, Latif H, Kim JN, Lockhart A, Artis K, David G, Taylor P, Streib J, Dorrestein PC, Grier A, Gill SR, Zengler K, Hata TR, Leung DY, Gallo RL.2017
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobials from human skin commensal bacteria protect against Staphylococcus aureus and are deficient in atopic dermatitis
